etymologies: Middle English (in the sense ‘line of people or animals’): from Old French range ‘row, rank’, from rangier ‘put in order’, from rang ‘rank’. Early usage also included the notion of ‘movement over an area’

definitions: the area of variation between upper and lower limits on a particular scale

examples.text: the cost is thought to be in the range of $1-5 million a day
it's outside my price range

shortDefinitions: area of variation between upper and lower limits on particular scale

definitions: the scope of a person's knowledge or abilities

examples.text: he gave some indication of his range

shortDefinitions: scope of person's knowledge or abilities

definitions: the compass of a person's voice or a musical instrument

examples.text: she was gifted with an incredible vocal range

shortDefinitions: compass of person's voice or musical instrument

definitions: the extent of time covered by something such as a forecast.
shortDefinitions: period of time covered by something such as forecast

definitions: the area or extent covered by or included in something

examples.text: an introductory guide to the range of debate this issue has generated

shortDefinitions: area covered by or included in something

definitions: the set of values that a given function can take as its argument varies.
shortDefinitions: set of values that given function can take as its argument varies

definitions: a set of different things of the same general type

examples.text: the area offers a wide range of activities for the tourist

shortDefinitions: set of different things of same general type

definitions: the distance within which something can be reached or perceived

examples.text: something lurked just beyond her range of vision

shortDefinitions: distance within which person can see or hear

definitions: the maximum distance to which a gun will shoot or over which a missile will travel

examples.text: these rockets have a range of 30 to 40 miles
a duck came within range

shortDefinitions: maximum distance to which gun will shoot or over which missile will travel

definitions: the maximum distance at which a radio transmission can be effectively received

examples.text: planets within radio range of Earth

shortDefinitions: maximum distance at which radio transmission can be effectively received

definitions: the distance that can be covered by a vehicle or aircraft without refueling

examples.text: the vans have a range of 125 miles

shortDefinitions: distance that can be covered by vehicle or aircraft without refuelling

definitions: the distance between a camera and the subject to be photographed

examples.text: handheld shots taken at extreme telephoto ranges can be pretty wobbly affairs

shortDefinitions: distance between camera and subject to be photographed

definitions: the horizontal direction and length of a survey line determined by at least two fixed points.
shortDefinitions: horizontal direction and length of survey line determined by at least two fixed points

definitions: a line or series of mountains or hills

examples.text: the coastal ranges of the northwest

shortDefinitions: line or series of mountains or hills

definitions: a series of townships extending north and south parallel to the principal meridian of a survey.
shortDefinitions: series of townships extending north and south parallel to principal meridian of survey

definitions: a line defined by landmarks or beacons, used to locate something offshore, especially a navigable channel or a hazard.
shortDefinitions: line defined by landmarks or beacons, used to locate something offshore

definitions: a large area of open land for grazing or hunting

examples.text: on dude ranches, tourists put on crisp new western gear to ride the range

shortDefinitions: large area of open land

definitions: an area of land or sea used as a testing ground for military equipment

examples.text: the cost of dealing with unexploded shells and bombs on former military ranges

shortDefinitions: area of land or sea used as testing ground for military equipment

definitions: an open or enclosed area with targets for shooting practice

examples.text: he went down to the ranges to practice shooting

shortDefinitions: open or enclosed area with targets for shooting practice

definitions: the area over which a plant or animal is distributed

examples.text: the chimpanzee extensively overlaps the gorilla in its forest range

shortDefinitions: area over which plant or animal is distributed

definitions: an electric or gas stove with several burners and one or more ovens

examples.text: a wood-burning kitchen range

shortDefinitions: large cooking stove with burners or hotplates and one or more ovens

definitions: a course of masonry extending from end to end at one height.
shortDefinitions: course of masonry extending from end to end at one height

definitions: a row of buildings.
shortDefinitions: row of buildings

definitions: the direction or position in which something lies

examples.text: the range of the hills and valleys is nearly from north to south

shortDefinitions: direction or position in which something lies

definitions: vary or extend between specified limits

examples.text: patients whose ages ranged from 13 to 25 years

shortDefinitions: vary or extend between specified limits

definitions: place or arrange in a row or rows or in a specified order or manner

examples.text: a table with half a dozen chairs ranged around it

shortDefinitions: place or arrange in row or rows or in specified manner

definitions: run or extend in a line in a particular direction

examples.text: he regularly came to the benches that ranged along the path

notes.text: no object, with adverbial of direction

shortDefinitions: run or extend in line in particular direction

definitions: (of a person or animal) travel or wander over a wide area

examples.text: patrols ranged thousands of miles deep into enemy territory
nomadic tribesmen who ranged the windswept lands of the steppe

notes.text: no object, with adverbial of direction

shortDefinitions: travel or wander over wide area

definitions: (of a person's eyes) pass from one person or thing to another

examples.text: his eyes ranged over them

shortDefinitions: pass from one person or thing to another

definitions: (of something written or spoken) cover or embrace a wide number of different topics

examples.text: tutorials ranged over a variety of subjects

shortDefinitions: cover wide number of different topics

definitions: obtain the range of a target by adjustment after firing past it or short of it, or by the use of radar or laser equipment

examples.text: radar-type transmissions which appeared to be ranging on our convoys

shortDefinitions: obtain range of target by adjustment after firing past it or short of it, or by use of radar or laser equipment

definitions: (of a projectile) cover a specified distance.
shortDefinitions: cover specified distance

definitions: (of a gun) send a projectile over a specified distance.
shortDefinitions: send projectile over specified distance
